symptoms.name: Nausea
symptoms.severity: Variable, can be mild to severe
symptoms.pattern: Usually onset within 0.5-6 hours (emetic) or 6-15 hours (diarrheal) after ingestion of contaminated food

symptoms.name: Vomiting
symptoms.severity: Variable, can be mild to severe
symptoms.pattern: Usually onset within 0.5-6 hours (emetic) or 6-15 hours (diarrheal) after ingestion of contaminated food; more common in emetic form

symptoms.name: Abdominal cramps
symptoms.severity: Variable, can be mild to severe

symptoms.name: Diarrhea
symptoms.severity: Variable, can be mild to severe
symptoms.pattern: More common in diarrheal form; watery diarrhea

vital_signs.temperature: Low-grade fever possible in diarrheal syndrome

lab_values.stool culture: >100,000 B. cereus organisms/gram of implicated food
lab_values.toxin detection: Blood test for diarrheal syndrome toxin

risk_factors: Consumption of contaminated food left at room temperature
Compromised immune system (increases risk of severe illness)

required: Symptoms consistent with emetic or diarrheal syndrome
Isolation of >100,000 B. cereus organisms/gram from epidemiologically implicated food
supportive: History of consuming potentially contaminated food
Positive toxin detection in blood (for diarrheal syndrome)
